subject: Re: [junit] Help,what's wrong with my TDD practice in my daily life?
msgSnippet: ... Agreed.  I think TDD is a great learning tool for beginners, and I definitely encourage Yang Gu to keep experimenting.  I also think he should not dismiss
messageBody:
On 9/10/07, Jeff Langr <jeff@...> wrote:

> Quoting Cédric Beust ? <cbeust@...>:
> > Just like everything else, use TDD sparingly.
>
> This is perhaps great advice for a very experienced developer, someone
> who has the prescience to know when they are about to write perfect
> code.
>
> Otherwise, for someone just starting out and learning TDD, I'd suggest
> trying to first learn how to grow solutions incrementally before
> deciding it's not their style.

Agreed. I think TDD is a great learning tool for beginners, and I
definitely encourage Yang Gu to keep experimenting. I also think he
should not dismiss what his friends are saying and that in a few
months, he'll be able to either prove them wrong or come to the same
conclusion they did.

--
Cédric
Author "Next Generation Testing in Java" (http://tinyurl.com/yvyxa3)
